abstract: Labor Dept reports Consumer Price Index gained 0.1 percent in April after 0.2 percent increase in March; so-called core CPI, which omits out food and energy costs, has largest rise since January 2013, at 0.3 percent.
lead_paragraph: Lower gas prices helped moderate the gauge of inflation, but there were signs of pressure from rising housing and health care costs.

headline.print_headline: Rising Housing Prices Help Push Inflation Index Higher

snippet: Lower gas prices helped moderate the gauge of inflation, but there were signs of pressure from rising housing and health care costs.
